Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; added white line above band of alternating red and black tongues with white outline; below, possible white zigzag band; exterior: mostly reserved; billet and square band between pairs of bands; at bottom of sherd two lines.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Lemos no. 1081 from Cyprus, and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA67.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1960) (phase 2)
